qas.question: Who suspected that the proposed baronial council would be unacceptable?
John appealed to who for help?
The failure of the agreement lead to what?

context: Neither John nor the rebel barons seriously attempted to implement the peace accord. The <a0_0>rebel barons<a0_0/> suspected that the proposed baronial council would be unacceptable to John and that he would challenge the legality of the charter; they packed the baronial council with their own hardliners and refused to demobilise their forces or surrender London as agreed. Despite his promises to the contrary, John appealed to <a1_0>Innocent<a1_0/> for help, observing that the charter compromised the pope's rights under the 1213 agreement that had appointed him John's feudal lord. Innocent obliged; he declared the charter "not only shameful and demeaning, but illegal and unjust" and excommunicated the rebel barons. The failure of the agreement led rapidly to the <a2_0>First Barons' War<a2_0/>.
